segment.source: Analyzing a Driver Using Code Analysis and Verification Tools
segment.target: Analyzing a Driver Using Code Analysis and Verification Tools

segment.source: Code analysis and verification tools can help improve the stability and reliability of your driver by systematically analyzing the source code.
segment.target: Code analysis and verification tools can help improve the stability and reliability of your driver by systematically analyzing the source code.

segment.source: The code analysis and verification tools can detect errors that are missed by the compiler and by conventional runtime testing.
segment.target: The code analysis and verification tools can detect errors that are missed by the compiler and by conventional runtime testing.

segment.source: Additionally they can determine whether the driver correctly interacts with the Windows operating system kernel.
segment.target: Additionally they can determine whether the driver correctly interacts with the Windows operating system kernel.

segment.source: Using Microsoft Visual Studio Ultimate 2012 and the Windows Driver Kit (WDK), you can configure the code analysis and verification tools to run as part of the build process, or you can schedule the tools to analyze your driver at a predetermined time.
segment.target: Using Microsoft Visual Studio Ultimate 2012 and the Windows Driver Kit (WDK), you can configure the code analysis and verification tools to run as part of the build process, or you can schedule the tools to analyze your driver at a predetermined time.

segment.source: C/C++ Code Analysis Tool for Windows Drivers
segment.target: C/C++ Code Analysis Tool for Windows Drivers

segment.source: The Windows 8 release of the WDK provides enhancements to the C/C++ Code Analysis tool included with Visual Studio.
segment.target: The Windows 8 release of the WDK provides enhancements to the C/C++ Code Analysis tool included with Visual Studio.

segment.source: Specifically, the WDK provides a specialized driver module that is designed to detect errors in kernel-mode driver code.
segment.target: Specifically, the WDK provides a specialized driver module that is designed to detect errors in kernel-mode driver code.

segment.source: This driver module is integrated into the C/C++ Code Analysis tool.
segment.target: This driver module is integrated into the C/C++ Code Analysis tool.

segment.source: When to use: You can run the C/C++ Code Analysis tool for drivers very early in the development cycle, as soon as the code compiles correctly.
segment.target: When to use: You can run the C/C++ Code Analysis tool for drivers very early in the development cycle, as soon as the code compiles correctly.

segment.source: For information about the Code Analysis tool in Visual Studio, see:
segment.target: For information about the Code Analysis tool in Visual Studio, see:

segment.source: Analyzing Application Quality using Code Analysis
segment.target: Analyzing Application Quality using Code Analysis

segment.source: Code Analysis for Drivers
segment.target: Code Analysis for Drivers

segment.target: How to run Code Analysis for drivers

segment.source: Using SAL Annotations to Reduce C/C++ Code Defects
segment.target: Using SAL Annotations to Reduce C/C++ Code Defects

segment.source: SAL 2.0 Annotations for Windows Drivers
segment.target: SAL 2.0 Annotations for Windows Drivers

segment.source: Note In previous versions of the WDK, the driver-specific module for code analysis was part of a standalone tool called PREfast for Drivers (PFD).
segment.target: Note In previous versions of the WDK, the driver-specific module for code analysis was part of a standalone tool called PREfast for Drivers (PFD).

segment.source: PREfast for Drivers was also integrated into the WDK Build environment, as part of Microsoft Automated Code Review (OACR).
segment.target: PREfast for Drivers was also integrated into the WDK Build environment, as part of Microsoft Automated Code Review (OACR).

segment.source: Static Driver Verifier
segment.target: Static Driver Verifier

segment.source: Static Driver Verifier (SDV) is a static verification tool that systematically analyzes the source code of Windows kernel-mode drivers.
segment.target: Static Driver Verifier (SDV) is a static verification tool that systematically analyzes the source code of Windows kernel-mode drivers.

segment.source: SDV determines whether the driver correctly interacts with the Windows operating system kernel.
segment.target: SDV determines whether the driver correctly interacts with the Windows operating system kernel.

segment.source: SDV can be launched from the Driver menu in Visual Studio or from the Visual Studio Command Prompt window.
segment.target: SDV can be launched from the Driver menu in Visual Studio or from the Visual Studio Command Prompt window.

segment.source: When to use: Run Static Driver Verifier early in the development cycle on drivers that compile correctly.
segment.target: When to use: Run Static Driver Verifier early in the development cycle on drivers that compile correctly.

segment.source: Run Static Driver Verifier before you begin the test cycle.
segment.target: Run Static Driver Verifier before you begin the test cycle.

segment.source: For information about Static Driver Verifier, see:
segment.target: For information about Static Driver Verifier, see:

segment.source: Overview: Static Driver Verifier
segment.target: Overview: Static Driver Verifier

segment.source: How to: Using Static Driver Verifier to find defects in drivers
segment.target: How to: Using Static Driver Verifier to find defects in drivers

segment.source: Note In previous versions of the WDK, Static Driver Verifier was a stand-alone tool that you launched from a WDK Build Environment window.
segment.target: Note In previous versions of the WDK, Static Driver Verifier was a stand-alone tool that you launched from a WDK Build Environment window.
